Title: Safety and Security Supervisor
RoleDescription:
This position is based out of our Technology Center in Bangaluru, Karnataka, India. 
We are Wayfair. We deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for a talented Lead Security Officer to join our Global Safety and Security Team. This is an incredible and unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing eCommerce company and to help build a department  your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!
The Lead Safety and Security Supervisor will be responsible for supporting the daily operations in the Wayfair Technology Center in Bangaluru India. The position will plan, coordinate and resource appropriate supplies, training and policies to prevent and mitigate risks from threats and injuries. This individual will be part of a dynamic team whose mission is to provide world class support to our partners. In addition, the individual will work on building and expanding the safety and security program and supporting the Global Safety and Security Team at Wayfair.
What Youll Do

Be an experienced leader who leads from the front and sets the example with the highest standards of discipline and professionalism
Partner with the Global Safety and Security Field Operations and the Safety Compliance and Standards Teams to support in in executing Global Safety and Security initiatives
Perform daily functions of the lead officer by monitoring alarms, access control, CCTV and events that may impact Wayfairs operations and assets.
Review, analyze, and escalate issues to help mitigate threats to Wayfair's employees, property, and partners in Bangaluru and other sites across the globe
Build and lead a safety and security program to ensure fully trained security coverage 24/7
Coordinate responses to incidents or crisis events that occur or could potentially impact Wayfairs operations
Perform key duties and be the key point of contact for first responders in the event of an emergency
Maintain detailed records of communications and events, including incident tracking and case management
Maintain effective working relationships with regulatory agencies, industry security and life safety professionals, vendors, and suppliers
Manage and handle sensitive incidents while maintaining the companys and affected individual's confidentiality
Manage a group of Corporate Security Officers and coverage schedules to support hours of operations at Wayfairs Technology Center in Bangaluru. Remote support to locations in Vietnam, Malaysia, and China.
Occasional travel to, but not limited to the United States, Europe, Vietnam, Malaysia, China.

What Youll Need

10+ years of experience working in a safety and security function, preferably in a physical security role or setting (either government or private sector)
Ability to work in a flexible schedule environment
Familiarity with access management technologies such as Lenel and Google Suite
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced work environment, think through problems, and make sound decisions under pressure
Must have the ability to communicate both written and orally with applicable stakeholders and represent Wayfair to external parties such as law enforcement
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Strong decision-making ability during both crisis and non-crisis situations
Must be able to stand and or walk in a variety of weather and terrain conditions for shifts up to 10 hours
Must be able to lift and hold 15 pounds.
Be able to work effectively in office and outdoor environments with hot and cold conditions, as well as loud noises
Ability to travel within your assigned area of responsibility. Occasional overnight travel may be required as needed.
Ability to occasionally travel to Malaysia, Vietnam, and China.

Title: Senior Product Manager - Observability Platforms
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bengaluru, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfairs core platforms are increasingly driven by a cutting edge set of software systems that interact in complex ways to ensure that we are using them to their full potential. Business applications of these systems span many fields including the order lifecycle, supply chain, supplier partnerships, and more! These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for complex systems combined with configurability for rapid testing and exploration.
We are looking for a seasoned Product Manager to accelerate the development of our technology stack. This person will work with cross-functional teams, including engineers, science teams, and analysts, on platform capabilities needed for helping our teams deploy faster and with more confidence.
This person will be working with product and engineering partners to set a platform vision, form strong relationships with cross functional partners (both technical and non-technical), aligning on a shared vision for success, and delivering results that create meaningful business impact. This person will translate the business and user needs into a pragmatic and iterative strategy and roadmap, along with providing specifications and user stories for the engineering teams. The product manager will serve as the subject matter expert, push for adoption for new use cases, and continually improve our platform capabilities.
 
What You'll Do:

Product Ownership: Serve as the subject matter expert and champion for release engineering, demonstrating a deep understanding of their technology, strengths, weaknesses, and market alternatives.
Strategic Planning: Partner with engineering leaders to develop and maintain a compelling product vision and roadmap, prioritizing feature requests based on business value and impact, and ensuring alignment with stakeholders.
End-to-End Delivery: Take full accountability for the successful delivery of platform enhancements and support, translating product outcomes into actionable engineering stories and tickets.
Adoption and Advocacy: Proactively market your products internally, measuring adoption, addressing gaps, and ensuring all potential users understand the value proposition.
Technical Acumen: Gain a deep understanding of the technologies underpinning your products, enabling you to influence technical pivots when necessary and architect high-level system plans.
Stakeholder Communication: Maintain open and transparent communication with stakeholders, providing regular updates on product progress and ensuring alignment with organizational goals.

 
What youll Need:

Product Management Experience: 8+ years of experience in product development, preferably with software platforms, demonstrating a proven track record of delivering successful products.
Technical Foundation: 3+ years of foundational understanding of software technologies, ideally with experience in accelerating deployment patterns.
Standards Development: Experience in developing or influencing standards related to access management, asset provisioning, and governance processes.
Data Analysis Skills: Proficiency in SQL, enabling you to extract ad hoc data for analysis and decision-making.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication abilities, with a demonstrated aptitude for explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Customer Focus: A passion for creating amazing, customer-centric products, with a focus on measuring their effectiveness and usability through clear KPIs.
Collaboration and Prioritization: Ability to effectively collaborate across multiple stakeholder groups, juggle large initiatives, and prioritize work based on impact.
Agile Experience: Experience working with engineering teams in an agile environment, including sprint planning, stand-ups, and backlog management.
Cloud Familiarity: Familiarity with Google Cloud and its data offerings is a plus.

Title: SDE II, Support Engineering Analyst, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
The Customer Technology team builds the global engine for the worlds leading online home destination, powering customer acquisition, retention and relationship management touching hundreds of millions of consumers. Were looking for a Support Engineer II for our internally facing customer success team to support our internal stakeholders by helping them effectively use our in-house Communications Platforms and Martech Feeds & Signals Platforms, ensuring delivery of high quality engaging content to customers across email & sms, paid search (Google), social (meta, tiktok, etc.), online video (OV, CTV) and more.
Support Engineer II will work closely with internal customers on incident response, configuration support, and small project implementation. This role is ideal for a self-starter who enjoys solving problems, managing clearly scoped technical work, and improving tools through feedback and iteration.
What Youll Do:
Platform & Stakeholder Support

Triage and resolve help and incident tickets via Slack and Jira queues.
Debug issues using platform tools (UI, GBQ, GraphQL, JSON) and APIs.
Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Educate internal stakeholders on Communications Platform and Feeds capabilities.
Serve as a liaison with Engineering, Product, and partner teams.

Feeds Management & Data Quality

Implement structured feed changes and troubleshoot delivery issues (e.g., data mismatches, campaign visibility, ingestion failures).
Use custom scripting language and JSON-based config tools to support feed integrations and QA.
Partner with Marketing and Engineering to reduce time-to-market on feed updates.
Coordinate with external publisher partners as needed to resolve integration blockers, clarify data expectations, or validate configuration changes.
Monitor feeds for data anomalies or processing failures.

Signals Management & Data Quality

Implement structured pixel and server-to-server changes and troubleshoot delivery issues (e.g. data mismatches, low signal send volumes, etc.)
Use custom scripting language and JSON-based config tools to support pixel and S2S integrations and QA.
Partner with Marketing, Engineering, and external partners to reduce time-to-market on signal integrations and updates.

Tooling & Project Implementation

Deliver on well-defined platform projects with minimal oversight.
Collaborate with partner teams on automation, validation, and monitoring improvements.
Maintain and improve documentation and runbooks for future self-service or automation efforts.
Propose and implement tooling enhancements based on recurring issues.
Identify automation opportunities across team and platform operations.
Contribute to building or scaling scripts, alerts, and diagnostics that reduce manual support needs.

Platform Architecture & Code Debugging

Develop strong working knowledge of Communications and Martech Platform architecture, integrations, and workflows.
Triage and debug issues involving minor JavaScript/React code.
Make infrequent but effective minor deployments to the platform's JS/React codebase.

Youre a Match If You Have:

3-5 years in technical support, engineering, or platform implementation roles (B2B or internal tools).
Strong hands-on experience with:

Parsing JSON and testing APIs (Postman)
SQL/GBQ for debugging or validation
Writing or understanding scripting logic

Comfortable independently driving work from intake to delivery.
Strong troubleshooting mindset using metrics, logs, and dashboards.
Clear communication skills across technical and stakeholder groups.
Customer-first mindset and a sense of ownership over technical support.

Working Hours:
This role includes partial overlap with U.S.-based teams. The team currently operates on a mid-day to evening shift. We do not require full U.S. coverage but expect consistent collaboration during overlapping hours. The rotational schedule will require hours up to 11pm IST.
Preferred Skills:

Knowledge of dashboard, metrics, monitoring, and logging technologies (Grafana, DataStudio, DataDog, Looker).
Experience in CRM, marketing tech, or product feed delivery (ads, search, SEO).
Familiarity with Git version control.
Some understanding of email specific HTML best practices. 
Previous usage of React / JavaScript, Python automation

Title: Planning & Allocation Associate
RoleDescription:
Associate, Planning & Allocation
The salary range base pay for this position is $64,000 - $70,500 per year.  The base salary base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
 
This is a full-time position (40 hours/week) based in our Boston office. Attendance in-office is required Monday - Thursday, Friday is WFH optional. 
At Wayfair Planning and Allocation, we believe there is a white space in the brick-and-mortar market and an opportunity to create a differentiated retail experience that showcases the breadth and depth of our catalog. The Planning and Allocation team partners across the organization to maximize the customer experience when shopping in person at our expanding fleet of Physical Retail Stores.  We work closely with Merchandising, Operations, and Inventory Management teams to drive availability and enticing assortment selections in stores, ensuring customers are able to shop and purchase the curated assortment they want to see. 
Wayfairs Physical Retail team is seeking a highly motivated Associate of Planning & Allocation who is comfortable operating in a fast paced and ambiguous environment for the Physical Retail P&A team to support the allocation of inventory to our stores. This role will partner with a variety of internal teams (Merchandising, Visual Merchandising, Marketing, Inventory Management) to support our Specialty Retail brands and execute the allocation strategy as we continue to scale stores across North America. 
Responsibilities:

Execute inventory movements to meet availability and turn goals at individual retail stores.
Clearly and concisely communicate business allocation status to business leads and Supply Chain and Store Operations teams for new store launches and seasonal flips 
Assist in developing efficient allocation processes that adhere to Go To Market calendar guidelines. 
Develop forecasts and execute allocations to bring seasonal assortment selections to life in the store. 
Identify risks and opportunities with the allocation process, and adjust as needed to ensure sustainable inventory practices.
Conduct ad hoc analyses using Excel and internal dashboards to drive decisions. Work cross functionally with multiple teams to solve business problems

Requirements:

1+ years in an operations or analytic focused role, with allocation or replenishment experience preferred
Strong analytical skills; to leverage data (quantitative and qualitative) to drive strategic decision-making and tight execution
Strong written & verbal communication skills. Ability to provide detailed updates internal & externally on performance, opportunities and go forward business strategies
Ability to prioritize workload autonomously
Bachelor's degree; studies in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Analytics, Business Administration, Operations Research, Economics, Statistics, a plus 
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel/ Google Sheets (including use of Pivot Tables, and complex formulas) to perform deep-dives on performance and analyze trends 
Retail experience is a plus, with preferred experience in Home or adjacent categories (e.g., general merchandise)

Title: Software Engineer II, Global Supply Technology
RoleDescription:
Location: Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are
Wayfair is one of the worlds largest destinations for the home, powered by a complex technology ecosystem that enables millions of customers to find the right products, at the right price, delivered seamlessly to their doorsteps.
Pricing and profitability are at the heart of Wayfairs strategy, and the algorithms that support them are critical to ensuring we remain competitive and sustainable. We are building horizontally scalable systems that power price generation, simulations, and profitability modelingrelying on data, experimentation, and machine learning to guide our decisions. These systems enable us to react quickly to market trends, optimize gross margins, and ensure an outstanding customer experience.
We are looking for passionate backend engineers to help us build and scale these mission-critical systems that drive decisions across pricing, profit, product placement, and customer satisfaction. This role sits at the intersection of backend engineering, data platforms, and applied machine learningtransforming experimental models into reliable, production-ready systems that operate at scale. Engineers in this space will not only solve complex technical challenges but also directly shape the way Wayfair competes in the global marketplace through smarter pricing and profitability strategies.
What Youll Do

Collaborate with Data Scientists and fellow Software Engineers to bring ML models into production.
Design, build, and maintain backend services and data pipelines that enable data-driven decision-making.
Write efficient, scalable, and maintainable code in Python, with a focus on high reliability and performance.
Develop and optimize Google BigQuery (GBQ)/SQL queries, including joins and aggregations across large datasets.
Ensure production readiness through testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation, and proactive troubleshooting.
Use orchestration tools (e.g., Cloud Composer) to schedule and manage workflows.
Support report generation and integrations with tools like Looker Studio or similar.
Take ownership of projects end-to-end, from design and implementation to scaling and ongoing maintenance.
Balance the open-ended nature of science-driven experiments with the rigor of production-grade engineering.

We Are a Match Because You Have

3  5 years of experience in backend software engineering with strong Python development skills.
Experience with SQL/GBQ, including writing queries and handling large-scale data.
Proven experience building and maintaining production systems with a focus on reliability.
A strong sense of ownership, curiosity, and continuous improvement mindset.
Excellent problem-solving and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical partners.

Nice to Have:

Experience working with Data Scientists to productionize ML models.
Familiarity with orchestration software (e.g., Cloud Composer, Airflow).
Experience with monitoring and alerting tools (e.g., DataDog, Prometheus).
Exposure to reporting/visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Tableau).

Title: Workflow Controller
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $102,942.00-$113,778.00 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
 Workflow Controller 
 
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
 
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan

RoleDescription:
Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091The entry pay for this position is $25/hr with uncapped quarterly bonus pay potential. Total compensation may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Overview:At Wayfair, we believe a home should be as functional as it is beautiful and that starts with great design. As a Sr. Retail Designer of Cabinetry and Home Renovation, you'll turn customer visions into reality, guiding them through their renovation journey with confidence, creativity, and care. From kitchens and bathrooms to laundry rooms and custom built-ins, you'll craft smart, stylish spaces that reflect each customers goals, budget, and style.
Youll tap into your expertise in cabinetry, bath, and kitchen design. Youll lean into Wayfairs expansive product catalog from cabinetry and tile to flooring and plumbing to provide complete solutions for DIY homeowners and professional contractors alike. If you're a proactive problem-solver with a passion for design and sales, and you love seeing a great project come to life, this is your stage.
What Does A Cabinetry and Home Renovation Designer Do?

 Own the Design Process: Lead cabinetry and home renovation projects from concept to completion. Use 2020 Design Live or similar software to develop layout plans, renderings, and product recommendations based on customer inputs, measurements, and needs.
 Be the Technical Expert: Educate customers on cabinetry construction types (framed vs. frameless), materials (MDF, plywood, solid wood), finishes (painted, stained, laminated), and specialty features (soft-close hinges, pull-outs, and more).
 Deliver Personalized Consultations: Whether it's in-store, virtual, or in-home, you'll meet customers where they are. You'll listen deeply, learn their style and renovation goals, and recommend functional, beautiful solutions tailored to their timeline and budget.
 Connect the Dots from Start to Finish: Develop floor plans, mood boards, 3D visuals, and complete product packages. You'll manage each projects full lifecycle, from early design to final purchase, and offer support through post-order services to ensure a smooth renovation experience.
 Educate + Inspire: Stay ahead of design trends and new materials, bringing fresh ideas to every customer interaction. Help customers see how tile, flooring, kitchen, bath, and plumbing products can work together to create the space theyve dreamed of.
 Leverage Design + Sales Tools: Use analytics and digital tools to build persuasive space plans, presentations, and shopping experiences that help grow the business while putting your creativity to work.
 Thrive in a Dynamic Environment: With evolving customer needs, product assortments, and promotions, youll stay focused, flexible, and ready to pivotall while delivering high-impact experiences.
 Always Be Selling (ABS): Every interaction is an opportunity. Youll generate new leads, build customer rapport, and close on personalized solutions that help grow your pipeline and the stores performance.
 Contribute to Store Success: Help with visual updates, floor sets, and inventory tasks as needed and bring your ideas to the table! Were a team that builds (and wins) together.

 
Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Design Experience: 3+ years of experience in kitchen, bath, cabinetry, or home renovation design. You know your way around spatial planning, product selection, and what works (and what wows). Bonus points for 12 years focused on cabinetry.
 Technical Proficiency: Youre confident working in 2020 Design software. Familiarity with CRM/POS systems (like Salesforce) helps too.
 Sales Know-How: Youve got a track record of meeting or beating your sales goals and you know how to build trust while selling big ideas and beautiful designs.
 Flexible Schedule: Retail hours mean nights, weekends, and holidays. Youre ready to show up when your customers need you most.
 Educational Background: A Bachelors degree or college diploma in a related field is preferred, but your experience and design sensibility speak volumes.
 Leadership + Training Experience: If youve mentored or trained others in a retail or design setting, even better! You know how to lift up your team and lead by example.
 Professional Certification (Preferred): NKBA, NAHB, NARI, or KBDI certifications are a plus and help you stand out as a true renovation pro.
 End-to-End Product Knowledge: You bring the full package from cabinetry to tile and have the confidence to guide customers through every step.
 Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in a team-focused environment and take pride in supporting your peers just as much as your customers.
 Top-Notch Organization: Strong attention to detail, follow-through, and communication make you a trusted partner from consultation to completion.

What is Supplier Inventory Management at Wayfair?
At Wayfair, Supplier Inventory Management (SIM) sits at the core of delivering a world-class customer experience. We partner with suppliers to maximise speed, availability, and efficiency across the supply chain. This means ensuring the right products are available at the right time  driving growth through smarter inventory positioning strategies and strong supplier collaboration. We leverage both Wayfairs fulfillment services (CastleGate) and suppliers own supply chain capabilities to optimise availability, cost, and scale.
As an Intern, youll step directly into this dynamic, data-driven environment  tackling real business challenges, solving problems, and delivering tangible results.

Your exact responsibilities will depend on your skills, interests, and team placement, but heres a snapshot of the impact you could have:


Develop & Execute Strategies: Optimise sales, in-stock rates, inventory turns, and network balance to drive growth.


Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with Analytics, Category Management, Forecasting, Marketing, and Operations teams to align on forecasts, trends, and supply chain strategies.


Own Projects: Lead initiatives such as promotional inventory planning, forward positioning, and sell-through actions.


Analyse & Optimise: Monitor key performance indicators, conduct root cause analysis, and implement corrective actions.


Strategise & Scale: Influence supplier assortment, availability, and operational strategies using insights from your analysis.

Fluency in English, both written and spoken.


Strong communication and collaboration skills  you thrive in team settings.


A proactive, can-do mindset  quick to learn, eager to take initiative.


An eye for detail and confidence working independently.


Interest in eCommerce, retail, or home & lifestyle products.


An interest in strategy and analytics, with a commercially minded approach to problem-solving.


Proficient in Excel and a curiosity for working with data.

Join a global eCommerce leader at the heart of one of its most strategic functions.


Gain real ownership from day one  your ideas will be heard, tested, and celebrated.


Collaborate with top talent and gain exposure to multiple business areas, from supply chain to marketing.


Benefit from hands-on mentorship designed to accelerate your learning.


Experience our vibrant, collaborative London office culture.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Fulfillment Orchestration
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy and Salary: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, MA, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
The salary range for this position is $161,000 - $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will also be provided as part of the compensation package.
 
Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our Product team plays a critical role in making this vision a reality by building technology that solves meaningful customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways. We work closely with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics, Third Party system and service providers and business leaders across the company to bring these solutions to life.
We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager for Supply Chain and Retail Technology to lead the build out of our Fulfillment Lifecycle State and Orchestration system. This tech provides instructions needed for various supply chain tech systems to fulfill the order and subsequently, keeps track of the fulfillment journey to take appropriate actions based on the happy and unhappy path scenarios. In this role, you will have the opportunity to operate in a greenfield space and be hands-on to build something that plays a critical role within the Wayfair supply chain ecosystem.
Youll act as a connective tissue between engineering, business stakeholders, operations, and external partners to deliver scalable and resilient solutions that power key business functions. This is a high-impact role for someone who thrives in cross-functional environments, can manage complex technical ecosystems, and is passionate about building something foundational and large scale that powers Wayfair supply chain. 
 
What Youll Do:

Build out the Fulfillment Lifecycle State and Orchestration systems by supporting new use cases and furthering the role that this system plays within Wayfair supply chain 
Lead Cross-Functional Initiatives by being the product lead for major, time-sensitive programs like 3P WMS integration, and Multichannel capabilities that bring value for the business and customers
Define future looking use cases through learnings from the existing capabilities, strong product discovery, and stakeholder feedback for mid to long term buildout.
Lead discovery efforts to gather and translate stakeholder needs into clear business and technical requirements.
Collaborate independently with Operations and Commercial stakeholders, and technology teams across supply chain, storefront and supplier-facing to drive improvements in speed, cost and customer experience metrics.

 
What You'll Need:

7+ years of product management experience, ideally focused on enterprise platforms, or integrations.
Strong track record of product discovery, defining the right problems to solve, and executing deliverables to solve those problems and unlock business outcomes
Comfortable discussing system workflows, tech design, and architecture decisions with engineers.
Experience in managing complex projects involving multiple cross-functional teams. 
Skilled at managing stakeholders, including senior leadership, and translating technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Strong communicator with a proven ability to collaborate across engineering, operations, and external partners. 
Positive, collaborative, and energetic approach to teamwork.

 
Why Youll Love Wayfair

We are the front-line leaders in the new Wayfair Global Supply Chain Workforce Support Network. We are positioned forward at all the network locations providing direct training & development support to our Supply Chain teams. We bring network-wide resources along with realistic and challenging training initiatives to optimize performance, employee engagement, and professional development for associates and leaders. We are culture enthusiasts throughout our entire Supply Chain network.  
We are looking for a proven leader to influence cross-functional teams responsible for development, standard work, and championing the Wayfair culture in Cranbury, NJ. The candidate must be a collaborative problem solver, strategic planner, one who can build & manage high performing teams in a fast-paced, rapidly challenging, and fluid environment. 
What You'll Do

Coordinate, lead, and execute all training functions within the Cranbury, NJ fulfillment center including new hire orientation, job function training, and continuous development.
Organize, develop, and lead a team of exceptional and dedicated Training Ambassadors within the Warehouse Associate population; focus on improving safety, quality, and retention.
Lead various training sessions as needed, including but not limited to: New Hire Fundamentals, Powered Industrial Vehicle (PIV) training, Quality & Process (Current & New SOP) Training.
Provide professional development programming for warehouse associates and leaders.

Manage priorities, set goals, and partner strategically with stakeholders to align network training initiatives with the local sites operational and training needs.
Flex to perform work and lead by example on the warehouse floor alongside department leaders and associates during high volume seasons or as needed

Leadership skills and the ability to make decisions with little or no guidance based on policies or best practices.
Exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively communicate with all stakeholder levels.

At this time, Wayfair does not provide visa sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
 
Must be on-site in Boston, MA (Monday-Thursday)
The salary range for this position is $104,500 - 118,250. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
 
Senior Business Analyst, Transportation & Delivery Process
We're looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Transportation & Delivery Process and Technology Enablement team. In this role, you'll be a key player in implementing new technology and processes for our last-mile delivery network. Your responsibilities will include gathering requirements from business stakeholders, validating them with our engineering team, and supporting the successful rollout of new solutions. You'll also be responsible for providing valuable insights into project performance.
Who We Are
The Global T&D Process & Technology Enablement team is the driving force behind significant change at Wayfair. We are the "go-to" team for any disruptive technology or process in the first, middle, or last mile of our supply chain. We ensure successful implementations by bringing the right people together, considering all implications during the design and build phases, and tracking the success of our rollouts. Our team is based in Boston but travels frequently to our Home Delivery Operations facilities to oversee new launches.
What You'll Do 
We are looking for an analytical, action-oriented, and collaborative individual who can translate business problems to tech improvements, actionable insights and data driven solutions  within the last mile delivery space, to influence operational results and tech systems. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story through data.

Become a SME in Wayfairs last mile tech and processes in order to answer questions from business stakeholders & execution and attend process and tech escalations
Become a liaison between engineering and business stakeholders to funnel the right requirements and convert them into product or process enhancements
Communicate regularly with cross functional partners to understand process gaps, business trends and new ways to break down problems into solutions
Engage in roadmapping and prioritization through diligent opportunity sizing and scoping efforts
Build dashboards, visualizations and prototypes to translate data sets into insights and actions
Conduct ad hoc analyses and build advanced reports 
Support tech and process rollout from requirements gathering to launch
Manage processes and multiple engagements with key cross-functional partners

What You'll Need 

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
2+ years of professional experience
Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change. 
Potential travel to Wayfair sites up to once/month
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:

Overview: 
At Wayfair, we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in furniture and home by empowering talented, driven individuals like you. As a Senior Assistant Store Manager of Sales, youll lead the sales floor team/ This includes sales, design, and customer experience to create seamless, welcoming shopping journeys. Youll be a key partner to the General Manager, driving sales, optimizing operations, and fostering collaboration across specialty categories like appliances, home improvement, and mattresses. If youre passionate about coaching teams, solving challenges in a fast-paced environment, and delivering authentic, customer-focused service, your professional home awaits you here at Wayfair.
What Does a Sr. Assistant Store Manager Do?

 Lead Sales & Design Teams: Directly manage and develop the sales floor team, including managers, sales associates, designers, and customer experience specialists, ensuring customers receive top-notch support and service.
 Be a Senior Operational Partner: Serve as a key-holder and senior support across Assistant Store Manager duties, especially in specialty areas like appliances, home improvement, and mattresses, to keep store operations running smoothly.
 Unite Store Teams: Collaborate across Salesfloor, Logistics, Visual, Asset Protection, Talent, and more to align goals and execute store-wide initiatives that elevate customer experience and business success.
 Champion Customer Experience: Deliver authentic, friendly service while coaching your team to build complex, connected solutions that balance speed with personalized attention.
 Drive Sales & Results: Partner with the General Manager to optimize our store processes, manage profitability, control labor expenses, and translate data into actionable coaching and team improvements.
 Foster Collaboration & Culture: Create a positive, team-first environment by encouraging cross-functional collaboration and continuous growth among Associates, Specialists, and Designers.
 Own Floor Operations: Maintain strong leadership presence as Manager on Duty handling scheduling, opening and closing procedures, and ensuring the right team is in the right place at the right time.
 Innovate & Improve: Contribute ideas for new tools, processes, and technologies that help your teams work smarter and more efficiently.
 Manage Multiple Priorities: Stay organized and communicate clearly while juggling fast-paced demands and following through on action plans.
 Partner with Home Office: Work closely with corporate teams to share insights and support store performance enhancements.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Proven Leadership: 5+ years managing large teams in fast-paced, high-volume retail or specialty selling environments, where you led with confidence and clear direction.

At Wayfair Supplier Inventory Management, we partner with thousands of suppliers to maximize customers experience. This means driving speed and availability through inventory and positioning strategies with suppliers leveraging Wayfairs fulfillment services (CastleGate) as well as suppliers own supply chain capacities. Work with senior team members, with a focus on structuring analyses, formulating portfolio strategies, and communicating findings to senior management

5+ years of work experience in E-commerce, Retail and Operations/ logistics/transportation industry preferred
Proven experience of taking on big challenges and delivering despite obstacles and limited resources
Ability to handle multiple projects, and synthesize data into consumable formats and bring actionable insights through effective communication
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel/ Google Sheets (including use of Pivot Tables, and complex formulae) to perform deep-dives on supplier performance and translate insights into compelling supplier pitches using Powerpoint / Google Slides
Consulting skills to interact with supplier and internal teams; able to flex communication style, persuade, explain, and drive results
Demonstrated ability to communicate with external executives
Experience managing others, preferred

Senior Business Analyst, Sales Analytics
Wayfair is seeking a relentlessly curious, solutions-oriented Senior Business Analyst to join the Sales Analytics & Data Enablement team within the Global Sales organization. The team exists to marry customer data across sources (internal and external) to deepen our business understanding of our customer base and use those insights to improve the shopping experience across Sales, Site, and Marketing channels. We provide thought leadership and analytical rigor needed to drive our rapidly evolving Wayfair Professional & Global sales teams.
The Sales Analytics & Data Enablement team is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing core reporting artifacts while improving the Sales and customer experience with targeted analyses supporting our Global Sales / B2B long term vision. Our team acts as the Business owners / liaisons to the Global Sales Data Engineering team, ensuring that Business needs are aligned. We are highly cross-functional and work closely with roles in the Technology group (eg: Product Management and Engineering) and are deeply embedded within the business (eg: Field operations, Marketing, and Storefront) with the ultimate goal of growing the Wayfair Professional & Global sales teams. 
In this role, you will be a key business contributor and assist with business insights for leaders driving the Wayfair Professional & Global sales team agendas. This role requires a blend of strong analytical experience, and the ability to communicate analytical insights in a crisp and clear way to the business. Stakeholder management and business acumen will be key components for success. You will apply your analytical knowledge to understand customer behavior and business performance and provide insights to the business designed to enable revenue growth, better customer experience, operational efficiency and profitability. You will think critically to tackle complex challenges in a fast-paced and high-growth environment. You will build a foundation as a trusted partner for the business, contributing insights that directly influence leadership decisions and strategic priorities
What Youll Do

Collaborate with senior leaders to identify key opportunities and challenges, providing data-driven insights that influence business strategies.
Develop a deep understanding of Wayfair Professional and B2C sales operations, including key performance indicators (KPIs) like efficiency and conversion rates, to provide meaningful recommendations.
Use tools like GBQ, SQL, and Looker to analyze customer and business data, synthesize insights, and present clear, actionable recommendations. Conduct analysis with clean data such as sales agent performance or dashboards and provide actionable takeaways and point of view when presenting business cases to senior leadership.
Propose innovative approaches to complex, non-routine problems by connecting analytical insights with business needs.
Work closely with teams across Technology (e.g., Product Management, Engineering) and the Business (e.g., Marketing, Field Operations) to ensure your insights drive action and results.
Oversee and refine analytical work by junior team members, providing guidance to ensure high-quality deliverables while fostering their growth.
Dive into the logic behind data models and operational processes to understand customer behavior, optimize lead generation, and identify opportunities for improved decision-making.
Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems with deep customer and business focus, leveraging your analytical acumen to recommend innovative business approaches as needed.

What Youll Need

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
Post-graduate work in related field, prior management consulting experience or internship, a plus
Strong analytical background and 2+ years of experience in extracting insights and operating with large data sets to identify trends and actionable takeaways
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Excellent communication, both written and verbally
Data and process-oriented, demonstrated ability to continuously learn new tools
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Ability to navigate an environment of continuous improvement working through ambiguity in an evolving organization
Ability to collaborate with partners in the Technology organization and the Business organizations to deliver real-time performance data to the business leadership team
A proactive approach to take initiative to dive deeper into the logic behind datasets and data models that are influencing customer targeting, call routing, customer valuation, and similar areas when necessary

Title: Asset Protection Manager
RoleDescription:
Asset Protection Manager
Location: Location: 1801 Howell Mill Road, Atlanta, GA 30318
The salary range for this position is $85,025-$95,712 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 

 
Overview:
At Wayfair, protecting our people, property, and reputation is at the heart of delivering amazing customer experiences. As our Asset Protection Manager, youll lead the charge in building and sustaining a culture of safety, trust, and accountability across the store. Reporting to the Regional Asset Protection Manager, youll oversee a talented team of ASMs, Specialists, and Guest Experience Hosts to ensure a secure, welcoming, and compliant environment that allows every customer and associate to thrive.
This is more than risk management, its about inspiring confidence, fostering collaboration, and ensuring that safety is woven into every part of the retail experience. Youll partner across functions like Sales, Logistics, Visual, and Talent to minimize shrink, respond to incidents, and champion proactive programs that keep our business resilient. If youre a hands-on, people-first leader with expertise in retail safety and security, with a passion for coaching teams, this is your opportunity to make a lasting impact.
 
What Does an Asset Protection Manager Do?

 Own the AP Strategy: Lead all asset protection and safety initiatives in your store, aligning with regional goals to minimize risk and maximize trust.
 Lead & Develop Your Team: Youll oversee, manage, and inspire a talented and diverse team of asset protection personnel, creating clear pathways for growth and accountability.
 Drive Shrink Reduction: Monitor data, investigate losses, and implement action plans that reduce shrink and improve operational integrity.
 Oversee Incident Response: Lead investigations and response efforts for theft, fraud, safety issues, or emergencies while ensuring thorough documentation and discretion.
 Train & Coach Teams: Deliver impactful training on safety, situational awareness, and emergency procedures. Ensure every team member understands their role in a secure environment.
 Build Cross-Functional Partnerships: Collaborate with Sales, Visual, Logistics, Facilities, Corporate, and other cross-functional teams to integrate AP practices into daily operations.
 Use Data to Inform Action: Leverage reporting tools, audits, and technology like CCTV to identify trends and develop proactive solutions.
 Champion a Culture of Safety: Model professionalism, reinforce compliance, and celebrate wins to keep AP top-of-mind without compromising customer experience.
 Communicate with Impact: Share updates with leadership and the regional AP team on performance trends, risks, and recommendations.
 Stay Hands-On: Be visible, engaged, and approachable on the floor, ready to act quickly and decisively when issues arise.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Retail Experience: 5+ years of asset protection experience in a retail environment, and 2+ at a supervisory level.
 Proven Leadership: 46 years of retail asset protection, security, or loss prevention experience, with at least 2+ years leading teams.
 AP & Safety Expertise: Strong knowledge of brick and mortar asset protection strategies, investigations, and compliance best practices (retail environment preferred).
 Problem-Solving Grit: Ability to balance short-term incident response with long-term prevention strategies in a fast-moving retail setting.
 Analytical Mindset: Skilled in leveraging data and reporting systems to spot risks, measure performance, and recommend improvements.
 Clear Communicator: Able to coach, train, and influence across all levels with professionalism and impact.
 Collaborative Spirit: Energized by working cross-functionally and synthesizing diverse perspectives into cohesive safety solutions.
 High Integrity: Trusted reputation for confidentiality, sound judgment, and professionalism.
 Schedule Flexibility: Willingness to work a retail schedule including evenings, weekends, holidays, and peak periods.
 Degree & Certifications: Wicklander-Zulawski certification is required within 90 days of hire. Bachelors degree, LPC, CFI, or other relevant certifications such as First Aid, CPR, AED, OSHA, PIV are preferred, but not required.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity:Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Ability to lift and move up to 50 lbs independently on a regular basis. Some projects may involve heavier items, which must be managed with proper assistance or equipment.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance-based increases.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.
 Wayfair Employee Discount: Save big on the pieces you loveplus get 10% off at our in-store restaurant .
 Parental Leave Options: Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
 And So Much More: Weve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in-store team can help with any questions!

Salary: The salary range for this position is 33,000 - 39,500 per year, however the base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
 
As a Junior Merchandiser, you will develop, execute and drive assortment strategies for your product class. Your ranges will become our Wayfair Verified items (Wayfairs super set of products that capture our highest % of revenue). You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. You will support strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on product placement. You will collaborate with Brand Management, Category Management, Marketing, Analytics & Operations, and external Suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging data-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and empower customers to create a home just right for them. 
 
What you'll do on any given day as a Curated Merchant...
As a Junior Merchandiser, you will be executing against our ambitious goals to shape our future curation strategy.  You will gain a deep understanding of the competitive market for your class. Leveraging this insight to build, curate, and maintain a category assortment strategy for our Wayfair Verified items, developing a shelf space plan and actively managing and iterating our product offering. You will ultimately decide which products will be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels, with a crisp business justification to support your selection and robust alignment with key stakeholders. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. Ensure your class range is competitive in both product and price.  You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A bachelor's/masters degree or qualified by experience
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs London office 3 days per week, Wayfairs Verified Studio 1 day per week in Birmingham &  1 day a week per week remote. Travel for competitor diligence & trade shows.

Title: Warehouse Supervisor
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $63,940 - $69,920 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Shifts:

Wednesday - Saturday 9:30 PM  8:00 AM 
Monday  Friday 8:00 PM  4:30 AM 

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customers needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. Weve been busy building a best-in-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard-working individuals to join our growing team  your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!
What You'll Do

Supervise the functions and working of the warehouse workers.
Delegate and assign tasks and targets and evaluate the work of the staff.
Adhere to the compliance of all legal and safety procedures.
Supervise proper shift allocations and ensure efficiency of all warehouse staff.
Organize and conduct necessary training activities for the staff and workers.
Ensure the proper functioning and safe operations of all warehouse tools and equipment.
Work effectively with other managers within functional team and supports new team members.
Drive specific initiatives that have proven business results.
Proactively think beyond the explicit assignment to ask second-order questions and identify additional analytic needs.
Accurately, quickly, and clearly answer questions related to your area of focus.
Be viewed as a credible company expert on your area of focus.
Effectively prepare and run internal meetings with supporting analytics and data.
Additional responsibilities as assigned.

What You'll Need

Bachelors or associate degree in management, administration, supply chain, customer service, or 5+ years working experience in product distribution to customer base.
Knowledge of the safety and legal documentation processes for handling related warehouse activities (MSDS, Equipment checklist, BOL).
Working understanding of Warehouse Management System.
Should have excellent leadership and administration skills and abilities.
Strong motivational, effectual team building, and decision-making skills.
Ability to effectively manage time and resolve crises.
Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.
Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
Ability to work overtime as needed.
